title: German submarine U-2543
text:
German submarine "U-2543" was a <a href="Type%20XXI%20submarine">Type XXI</a> <a href="U-boat">U-boat</a> (one of the ""<a href="Elektroboot">Elektroboot</a>e"") of <a href="Nazi%20Germany">Nazi Germany</a>'s "<a href="Kriegsmarine">Kriegsmarine</a>", built for service in <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>. She was ordered on 6 November 1943, and was <a href="Keel%20laying">laid down</a> on 13 November 1944 at the <a href="Blohm%20%26amp%3B%20Voss">Blohm & Voss</a> yard at <a href="Hamburg">Hamburg</a>, as yard number 2543. She was <a href="Ceremonial%20ship%20launching">launched</a> on 9 February 1945, and <a href="Ship%20commissioning">commissioned</a> under the command of "<a href="Oberleutnant%20zur%20See%20">Oberleutnant zur See </a>" Gottfried Stolzenburg, on 7 March 1945.
Design.
Like all <a href="Type%20XXI%20submarine">Type XXI</a> <a href="U-boat">U-boat</a>s, "U-2543" had a displacement of when at the surface and while submerged. She had a total length of (<a href="o/a">o/a</a>), a beam of , and a draught of . The submarine was powered by two <a href="MAN%20SE">MAN SE</a> supercharged six-cylinder M6V40/46KBB diesel engines each providing , two <a href="Siemens-Schuckert">Siemens-Schuckert</a> GU365/30 <a href="Motor%E2%80%93generator">double-acting</a> electric motors each providing , and two Siemens-Schuckert <a href="Silent%20running%20%28submarine%29">silent running</a> GV232/28 electric motors each providing .
The submarine had a maximum surface speed of and a submerged speed of . When running on silent motors the boat could operate at a speed of . When submerged, the boat could operate at for ; when surfaced, she could travel at . "U-2543" was fitted with six <a href="torpedo%20tube">torpedo tube</a>s in the bow and four <a href="2%20cm%20FlaK%2030">C/30</a> <a href="anti-aircraft%20warfare">anti-aircraft guns</a>. She could carry twenty-three <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a>es or seventeen torpedoes and twelve <a href="Naval%20mine">mines</a>. The <a href="Ship%27s%20company">complement</a> was five officers and fifty-two men.
Fate.
"U-2543" was <a href="scuttling">scuttled</a> on 3 May 1945, at <a href="Kiel">Kiel</a> as part of <a href="Operation%20Regenbogen%20%28U-boat%29">Operation Regenbogen</a>. The wreck was later raised and broken up.
